translated: Points of Controversy
The Fifty on Latent Tendencies
12. The Twelfth Section
The Discussion of Restraint and Action
Is restraint action?
Yes.
Is restraint of the eye faculty eye action?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  so t indriya savaraḥ pe  gha an indriya savaraḥ pe
translated: You should not say so.🔽Is restraint of the ear faculty …🔽Is restraint of the nose faculty …
Is restraint of the tongue faculty …
Is restraint of the body faculty body action?
You should not say so.
Is restraint of the body faculty body action?
Yes.
Is restraint of the eye faculty eye action?
You should not say so.
Is restraint of the body faculty body action?

analyzed: āmantā  so t indriya savaraḥ pe
translated: Yes.🔽Is restraint of the ear faculty …
Is restraint of the nose faculty …
Is restraint of the tongue faculty tongue action?
You should not say so.
Is restraint of the mind faculty mind action?
You should not say so.
Is restraint of the mind faculty mind action?
Yes.
Is restraint of the eye faculty eye action?
You should not say so.
Is restraint of the mind-faculty a mental action?

analyzed: āmantā  so t indriya savaraḥ pe
translated: Yes.🔽Is restraint of the ear-faculty …
Is restraint of the nose-faculty … Is restraint of the tongue-faculty …
Is restraint of the body-faculty a bodily action?
You should not say so.
Is unrestraint an action?
Yes.
Is unrestraint of the eye-faculty an eye-action?

You should not say so.
Is unrestraint of the body-faculty a bodily action?
Yes.

You should not say so.
Is unrestraint of the body-faculty a bodily action?

analyzed: āmantā  saḥ t indriya asa varaḥ pe
translated: Yes.🔽Is unrestraint of the ear-faculty …

analyzed: gha an indriya asa varaḥ pe
translated: Is unrestraint of the nose-faculty …
Is unrestraint of the tongue-faculty a tongue-action?
You should not say so.
Is unrestraint of the mind-faculty a mental action?

“Is the unguardedness of the mind a mental action?”
“Yes.”
“Is the unguardedness of the eye an eye action?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the unguardedness of the mind a mental action?”

analyzed: āmantā  saḥ t indriya asa varaḥ pe  gha an indriya asa varaḥ pe
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Is the unguardedness of the ear …🔽the unguardedness of the nose …
the unguardedness of the tongue …

analyzed: kāya indriya asavaraḥ  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: the unguardedness of the body a bodily action?”🔽“No.”
“Is it not so that
both restraint and unrestraint are action?”
“Yes.”
But has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā nimittaggāhī hoti …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā nimitta ggāhī hoti pe
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, having seen a form with the eye, a bhikkhu grasps at its signs and features.

original: na nimittaggāhī hoti, sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…
analyzed: na nimitta ggāhī hoti sotena saddam sutvā pe
translated: Having heard a sound with the ear …

analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya nimitta ggāhī hoti pe
translated: having cognized a mental phenomenon with the mind, he grasps at its signs and features.

analyzed: na nimitta ggāhī hoti iti  atthā iva suttanto ti
translated: He does not grasp at its signs and features.”

analyzed: āmantā  tena hi savaropi a savaropi
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then restraint and unrestraint are action.”
The Discussion of Restraint and Unrestraint is finished.
